site_name: Land To The East Side Of Acton Railway Station
description: Application for a Minor Material Amendment (s73) to vary condition 2 (Approved Plans), condition 3 (Approved Materials), condition 4 (Hard and Soft Landscaping) and condition 8 (Boundary Treatment) of planning permission ref: PP/2013/1074 dated 30/03/2016 (as amended by 171850VAR dated 17/11/2017) for: Construction of a five storey building comprising eighteen residential flats; internal access, parking and cycle parking and refuse storage (following demolition of brickwork walls and partitions). Variation seeks modification, re-configuration and internal changes to Units 1, 2, 3, 4, 17 and the penthouse; modification to building outline; facade external modification and revision of building materials; removal of areas of external deck access; modification of front gardens/defensible space to ground floor apartment entrances; and reduction and alterations to gable elevations/ends
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of planning permission PP/2013/1074 dated 30/03/2016
Reason: Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s):

106_100_Site Location Plan Rev A; 106_110_Proposed Site Plan Rev B; 106_200_Proposed Ground Floor Plan Rev B; 106_201_Proposed First and Second Floor Plans Rev B; 106_202_Proposed Third and Forth Floor Plans Rev B; 106_203_Proposed Roof Plan Rev B; 106_300_Proposed East and West Site Elevations Rev B; 106_301_Proposed East and West Elevations Rev B; 106_302_Proposed South and North Elevations Rev B; 106_400_Proposed Section W-W Rev B; 106_401_Proposed Section X-X Rev B; 106_402_Proposed Section Y-Y Rev B; 106_403_Proposed Section Z-Z Rev B; 106_25_01_Window detail; 106_25_02_Balcony detail; 106_25_03_Penthouse terrace detail; 106_510_Boundary Detail Rev B; ACT-1000 Rev C
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| Development works shall be implemented in accordance with the approved materials shown in drawings 106_300_Rev B; 106_301_Rev B; 106_DAS pages 10 & 11; 106_25_01_Window detail; 106_25_02_Balcony detail; and 106_25_03_Penthouse terrace detail. Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012)  and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016). | Development works shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details of hard and soft landscaping with the details approved under application reference 165761REM dated 19.12.2016 and plan no. 106_110_Proposed Site Plan Rev B. These works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.

Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 5.10 and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policy 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016).

| No trees, shrubs or hedges within the site or within the adjacent Acton Park which are shown to be retained on the plans shall be felled, uprooted, willfully damaged or destroyed, cut back in any way or removed without previous written consent of the Local Planning Authority.  Any shrubs or hedges removed without consent or dying or being severely damaged or becoming seriously diseased within 5 years from the completion of the development hereby permitted shall be replaced with shrubs or hedge plants or similar species capable of achieving a comparable size unless the Local Planning Authority gives written consent to any variation.  Any trees removed without consent or dying or being severely damaged or becoming seriously diseased within 5 years from the completion of the development hereby permitted shall be replaced in accordance with trees, shrubs or hedge plants of similar size and species unless the Local Planning Authority gives written consent to any variation.

Reason: To secure protection of trees, shrubs and hedges growing within the site which are of amenity value to the area in accordance with policies 3.5, 5.10 and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policy 7.6 of the London Plan (2016). | All operational works (including initial site clearance) shall be carried out in accordance with approved details in 166179CND dated 24.11.2017 which sets out the Arboricultural Method Statement for protection of existing trees, shrubs and hedgerows within Acton Park.

All tree protection methods detailed in the approved Arboricultural Method Statement shall not be moved or removed, temporarily or otherwise, until all works including external works have been completed and all equipment, machinery and surplus materials have been removed from the  site, unless the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority has first been sought and obtained.

Reason: To secure the protection, throughout the time that the development is being carried out, of trees, shrubs and hedges growing within or adjacent to the site which are of amenity value to the area in accordance with policies 5.10 and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policy 7.6 of the London Plan (2016).	 | The Tree Protection Measures shall be implemented in accordance with the approved Program of monitoring all approved tree protection measures dated 24th October 2016 in accordance with the details approved under application reference 165763REM dated 19.12.2016. The program of Arboricultural monitoring shall be taken in full compliance with the approved details.  No variation of the approved monitoring program shall take place without the prior written agreement of the Local Planning Authority

Reason: In order to safeguard trees and other vegetation considered to be worthy of retention in the interests of visual amenity for the area in accordance with policy 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013) policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policy 7.6 of the London Plan (2016). | Development works shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details of boundary treatment (including any internal boundary fences / walls) approved under application reference 165764REM dated 19.12.2016 and drawing 106_510_Boundary Detail Rev B . The approved boundary treatment shall be completed before the buildings are occupied and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: To protect the visual appearance of the area in accordance with policies 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012)  and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016).	 | Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved drawings, the proposed hard surface area to the front of the development site shall be block paved as a shared surface area.

Reason: To ensure that adequate and safe pedestrian routes are provided within the site, in accordance with policy 3.5 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and in the interests of general highway safety.	 | The visitor car parking spaces and internal cycle storage shown on drawing ACT-1000 Revision C shall be marked out / provided on site prior to first occupation of any part of the development, and the spaces/cycle storage provision shall be kept continuously available for the life of the development and shall not be used for any other purpose.

Reason: To ensure that there is adequate parking and servicing provision within the site, in accordance with policies 3.5 and 6.13 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policy 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016). | Refuse and recycling storage areas indicated on drawings ACT-1000 Revision C and 106_110_Proposed Site Plan Rev B shall be provided and brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained permanently thereafter.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the visual amenity and character of the area in accordance with policies 3.5, 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policies 3.5 and 7.4 of the London Plan 2016. | No development shall take place until the site investigation and risk assessment  has been completed in accordance with the details approved under 166358CND dated 24.11.2017; works to be undertaken by a competent person.

Reason: To protect the health and living conditions of residents in the area in accordance policy 5.21 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013), policy 5.21 of The London Plan, policy 1.1 j of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), and the National Planning Policy Framework. | Development works shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details of noise, vibration mitigation measures and ventilation provision in accordance with the details approved under application reference 165765REM dated 21.12.2016. Such details as approved shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation, and retained permanently.	.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties and future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 7.14 & 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Two wheelchair user units shall be designed and constructed to meet Approved Document M (Volume 1: Dwellings), Part M4(3) (Wheelchair user dwellings) of Building Regulations 2015. The units that are not wheelchair user dwellings shall be designed and constructed to meet Approved Document M (Volume 1: Dwellings), Part M4(2)(Accessible and adaptable dwellings) of Building Regulations 2015.

Reason: To ensure that the development is adaptable, flexible, convenient and appropriate to the changing needs of the future occupiers, in accordance with policies 3.5, 3.8 and 3.9 of the London Plan (2016); and policy 1.1(h) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy (2012). | The details for a Construction Logistics Plan approved under permission 166358CND dated 24.11.2017 shall be implemented on commencement of any works on site and the site shall be managed in accordance with the approved plan for the duration of demolition and construction, or as otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policy 5.18 of the London Plan 2016. | The pre-commencement details approved under permission 165766REM dated 25.02.2019  to achieve an overall minimum reduction in carbon dioxide emissions by 25% (regulated carbon dioxide emissions) above Building Regulations 2010 shall be adhered to.   After completion of the development Energy Performance Certificates [EPC's] and modelling output reports from the "as built stage" ; followed by Post construction energy monitoring of the development upon final completion and for a period of three years; shall be submitted to the local planning authority to confirm compliance in terms of savings achieved through energy efficiency measures.

Reason: To ensure the proposal contributes to its climate change mitigation requirements in accordance with policies 1.1 (k), 1.2 (f) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy LV 5.2 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 5.1 and 5.7 of the London Plan (2016), and section 10 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| The Pilling Method Statement shall be implemented in accordance with the approved construction logistics plan in accordance with the details approved under application reference 165767REM dated 19.12.2016. Any piling must be undertaken in accordance with the terms of the approved piling method statement.

Reason: The proposed works would be in close proximity to underground water and sewerage utility infrastructure. | No part of the proposed balconies within the development shall be used as storage areas or areas for the hanging or drying of washing at any time.

Reason:  To protect the appearance and character of the area, in accordance with policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policy 7.6 of the London Plan (2016).
